intro: Stisseria planiflora, commonly known as the flat-flowered stisseria, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Stisieraceae and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and small, flat, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
